it.polimi.se2018.model

Class WindowFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.model.WindowFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class WindowFrame
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class consists both of public and private methods it is used to create the WindowFrame that each Player has it will need to contain a PatternCard which will be randomly getCell from a pool found inside the JSON file
    Author:
    Federico Ferri, Alessio Fiorentino, Simone Francavilla
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • WindowFrame

        public WindowFrame(PatternCard pc,
                   boolean wcFace)
        This is the constructor method of the class
        Parameters:
        pc - the PatternCard to set to the WindowFrame.
        wcFace - if this parameter is true the player chose the front "map" of the PatternCard otherwise it will be the back

      • WindowFrame

        public WindowFrame(WindowFrame wf)
        This method is used to clone the WindowFrame
        Parameters:
        wf - is the WindowFrame instance to be cloned.

    • Method Detail

      • touchingCheck

        public boolean touchingCheck(int row,
                             int col)
        This method controls if there's at least one die near the position in which I want to insert the die instantiated.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the wanted positioning place.
        col - The column of the wanted positioning place.
        Returns:
        a boolean value expresses if there's at least one die near the wanted position.

      • crossCheck

        public boolean crossCheck(Die die,
                          int row,
                          int col)
        This method controls the correctness of a die positioning: if the window-frame is empty; if the window-frame is not empty, using 'OrthogonalCheck' and 'TouchingCheck';
        Parameters:
        die - The die passed to be positioned.
        row - The row of the wanted positioning place.
        col - The column of the wanted positioning place.
        Returns:
        true if the rule is met.

      • checkRestrictions

        public boolean checkRestrictions(Die die,
                                 int row,
                                 int col)
        This method checks whether all the placement rules are met
        Parameters:
        die - the die to be placed.
        row - the row position.
        col - the column position.
        Returns:
        true if the rules are met.

        public void placeDie(Die die,
                     int row,
                     int col)
        This method is used to insert the die into the selected position.
        Parameters:
        die - The die passed to be positioned.
        row - The row of the wanted positioning place.
        col - The column of the wanted positioning place.

      • removeDie

        public Die removeDie(int row,
                     int col)
        This method is used to remove a die in a cell in the WindowFrame.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the wanted positioning place.
        col - The column of the wanted positioning place.
        Returns:
        the die that is removed from its original position.

      • cardDifficulty

        public int cardDifficulty()
        This method is used to check the PatternCard difficulty.
        Returns:
        The PatternCard's level.

      • getDie

        public Die getDie(int row,
                  int col)
        This method is used to show up a die in an inserted position.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the wanted positioning place.
        col - The column of the wanted positioning place.
        Returns:
        a Die instance, that's the one placed on the frame.

      • getPCCell

        public Cell getPCCell(int row,
                      int col)
        This method is used to provide the Cell of the selected WindowFrame.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the wanted positioning place.
        col - The column of the wanted positioning place.
        Returns:
        a Cell instance, relative to the selected position.

      • getPlacements

        public Die[][] getPlacements()
